title: compSPI
body: compSPI is an algorithm benchmarking suite for cryogenic electron microscopy (cryo-EM) particle reconstruction. The project aims to accelerate the development of novel reconstruction methods while standardizing their performance.

title: "McQueen" Simulated Robot
body: As part of a team I developed a computer vision-based navigation algorithm that allowed a simulated robot to traverse a designated competition surface. The robot leveraged SIFT to gather license plates from passing vehicles, and a CNN to identify alphanumeric plate numbers.

title: Recycling Robot
body: I built a robot capable of locating aluminum cans distributed throughout a competition surface, and depositing them in a rear-attached storage box (not shown). The robot leveraged sonar for can retrieval and an IR sensor to detect and stay within the bounds of the competition area.
